sense.name: PURPORT TO: Have the often false appearance of being, intending (to), or claiming (to).
sense.commentary: NOTE: Has to do with appearance of intent or being, not actual intent or being.
sense.examples: She is not the person she purports to be. The letter purports to express people's opinion, but in fact echoes government rhetoric. The content of nonprescription capsules purported to contain dehydroepiandrosterone was analyzed.

sense.name: Propose or intend.
sense.commentary: INCLUDES: PURPORT TO NOTE: Compare to Sense 1: Sense 2 does not imply doubt or falsity.
sense.examples: Her letter may purport her forthcoming arrival. It is important to note that the premises of an argument purport to support the conclusion of the argument.
